title: Course Management Guide
description: Everything you need to know about managing your course

sections.title: Course Overview
sections.content: A course is a container for your educational content. Each course belongs to your organization and can have multiple instructors, students, and learning materials.
tips: Courses are linked to your organization - only members of your organization can be instructors
Each course has a primary lecturer who is the main instructor
You can add sub-courses (modules) to organize content into sections

sections.title: Managing Instructors
sections.content: Instructors are lecturers who help teach and manage the course. You can add multiple instructors with different roles.
tips: Primary Lecturer: Set when creating the course, this is the main instructor
Additional instructors must have a LECTURER role in the system
To add an instructor, they must either be in your organization OR you can add them by email
Instructor roles: Lead Instructor, Instructor, Teaching Assistant (TA), Reviewer

roles.name: Lead Instructor
roles.description: Senior instructor with full course management permissions

roles.name: Instructor
roles.description: Standard instructor who can manage content and students

roles.name: Teaching Assistant
roles.description: Assists with grading and student support

roles.name: Reviewer
roles.description: Can review and provide feedback on course content

sections.title: Course Groups
sections.content: Groups help organize students for collaborative learning, discussions, or project work.
tips: Create groups to organize students into smaller teams
Groups can have member limits to control team sizes
Different group types: Study, Discussion, Project, Custom
Students can be assigned to groups during enrollment

groupTypes.name: Study Group
groupTypes.description: For collaborative studying and peer learning

sections.title: Student Enrollments
sections.content: Enrollments track which students are taking your course and their progress.
tips: Only users with STUDENT role can be enrolled
You can enroll students by selecting from a list or entering their email
Optionally assign students to a cohort and/or group during enrollment
Track student progress and completion status

sections.title: Course Cohorts
sections.content: Cohorts are scheduled runs of your course with specific start and end dates.
tips: Use cohorts to run the same course multiple times (e.g., Spring 2025, Fall 2025)
Set enrollment limits per cohort
Cohort statuses: Planned, Active, Completed, Archived
Students can be assigned to cohorts during enrollment

sections.title: Sub-Courses (Modules)
sections.content: Sub-courses are modules or sections within your course that contain lessons and quizzes.
tips: Organize your course content into logical modules
Each sub-course can have multiple lessons
Add quizzes to test student understanding
Reorder sub-courses to control the learning path

quickActions.label: Add Instructor
quickActions.description: Add a lecturer to help teach this course

quickActions.label: Create Cohort
quickActions.description: Schedule a new run of this course

faq.question: Why can't I add an instructor?
faq.answer: Instructors must have a LECTURER role. If no lecturers appear in the dropdown, try using 'Add by Email' to search for lecturers outside your organization.

faq.question: What's the difference between a group and a cohort?
faq.answer: A cohort is a scheduled run of the course (like a semester), while a group is a smaller team within the course for collaboration.

faq.question: How do I add content to my course?
faq.answer: Create sub-courses (modules) first, then add lessons and quizzes within each sub-course.

faq.question: Can a student be in multiple groups?
faq.answer: Yes, students can be members of multiple groups within the same course.
